details.top: Say ten times or once if lazy. [1]  OR  100 times:
details.arabic_diacless: لا إلٰه إلا اللٰه وحده لا شريك له، له الملك وله الحمد، وهو على كل شيء قدير
details.arabic: لَا إِلٰهَ إِلَّا اللّٰهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيْكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ، وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيْرٌ
details.transliteration: Laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu wahdahu laa shareeka lahu, lahul-mulku wa lahul-hamdu, wa Huwa 'alaa kulli shay'in Qadeer.
details.translations: None has the right to be worshipped except Allaah, alone, without any partner, to Him belong all sovereignty and praise, and He is over all things omnipotent.
details.bottom: Whoever recites this hundred times in the morning, Allah swt will reward him of freeing ten slaves, Allah will write one hundred Hasanat and and forgive him one hundred misdeeds and be protected from Satan until evening. [2]
details.reference:
[1] An-Nasa'i, Abu Dawud 4/319, Ibn Majah, Ahmad 4/60.
[2] Al-Bukhari 4/95, Muslim 4/2071.

pageTitle: Freeing Ten slaves, 100 Rewards, 100 Sins taken away
